help.title: Help & Security Center

privacy.title: Privacy & Data Security
privacy.intro: Your privacy is paramount. Here's how OTP Guardian handles your data in this simulation:
privacy.item1Body: All analysis happens directly in your browser. No messages, images, or personal data are ever sent to or stored on a server.
privacy.item2Body: The "Analysis History" log is saved only in your browser's local storage. Clearing your browser data will erase this history.
privacy.item3Body: This application does not use cookies or tracking scripts to monitor your activity.
privacy.outro: In a real-world mobile app, these principles would be strictly enforced to ensure maximum user privacy.

howItWorks.title: How OTP Guardian Works
howItWorks.intro: OTP Guardian is a security simulator that uses advanced AI to analyze messages and images for potential threats, helping you stay safe from scams.
howItWorks.item1Body: Detects suspicious One-Time Passwords (OTPs), phishing links, and dangerous scam patterns like "Digital Arrest" by analyzing language, sender, and context.
howItWorks.item2Body: Scans images for hidden data (steganography), such as malicious QR codes, hidden text, or embedded files that could compromise your device.

bestPractices.title: General Security Best Practices
bestPractices.item1Body: Create unique and complex passwords for each of your online accounts.
bestPractices.item2Body: Always enable Two-Factor Authentication for an extra layer of security.
bestPractices.item3Body: Avoid accessing sensitive accounts (like banking) on unsecured public networks.
bestPractices.item4Body: Regularly update your OS and apps to get the latest security patches.
bestPractices.item5Body: If a link or attachment seems suspicious, don't open it. Verify the sender first.

digitalArrest.title: Digital Arrest Scam
digitalArrest.body: Fraudsters impersonate Law Enforcement officials and threaten arrest. Never share personal info or pay them.

fakeParcel.title: Fake Parcel Scam
fakeParcel.body: Scammers claim your parcel contains illegal items. Don‚Äôt click unknown delivery links. Verify with the courier service directly.

apkFraud.title: .APK File Fraud
apkFraud.body: Fraudsters send malicious .apk file links via SMS or WhatsApp. Only download apps from official app stores.

jobOffer.title: Job Offer Fraud
jobOffer.body: Fake job offers ask for fees or banking details. Never pay for a job offer or share sensitive financial information.

esimFraud.title: eSIM Fraud
esimFraud.body: Scammers send fake eSIM activation links to take over your number. Never click suspicious eSIM links or share OTPs.

moneyMule.title: Money Mule Fraud
moneyMule.body: Fraudsters offer easy money to trick you into moving illicit funds through your bank account. Never let anyone use your account for transactions.

lottery.title: Lottery & Prize Scams
lottery.body: If you "won" a prize for a contest you never entered, it's a scam. You should never have to pay a fee to claim a legitimate prize.

help.disclaimer: This is a web simulation. In a real app, analysis would happen locally on your device to protect your privacy.

sim_swap.title: SIM Swap Fraud
sim_swap.text: Attackers transfer your number to their SIM to intercept OTPs. Watch for sudden loss of signal.

phishing.title: Phishing Attacks
phishing.text: Attackers create fake websites or send deceptive messages to steal your credentials. Never click links in unexpected messages.

account_takeover.title: Account Takeover
account_takeover.text: Attackers use stolen passwords to gain access. Use strong, unique passwords and 2FA.

digital_arrest.title: Digital Arrest Scam
digital_arrest.text: Scammers impersonate police to create panic and demand money. Real authorities will not conduct investigations over WhatsApp or demand urgent payment.

rules.esim: Mentions eSIM activation, which can be a vector for SIM swap fraud.
rules.lottery: Claims you've won a prize, a common lottery scam.
rules.otpLike: Contains an OTP-like code. Verify the source before using.
rules.biometric: Asks for verification of biometric data, which is an unusual request via text.
rules.mfa: References multi-factor authentication; verify any requested action.
rules.hardwareKey: Mentions a hardware security key, a high-value target for scammers.
rules.containsLink: Contains a link. Verify before clicking, as it cannot be checked offline.
